comments: It seems likely that every number will eventually appear.
references: Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Z-Sequences, Vol. 4 (No. 42, Sep 1976), pp. 12-16.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe and N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 [First 1000 terms form T. D. Noe]
Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Z-Sequences, continued. Annotated and scanned copy of pages 14, 15, 16, 18 of Vol. 5 (No. 56, Nov 1977).
J. Shallit, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane Mar 14, 1979, concerning A001787, A005209, A005210, A005211
maple: f:=proc(n) option remember;if n <= 1 then 1 else abs(2*f(n-2)+f(n-1)-n); fi; end;[seq(f(n),n=1..60)]; # from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2015
prog: (Haskell)a005210 n = a005210_list !! (n-1)a005210_list = 1 : 1 : (zipWith ((abs .) . (-))    [3..] $ zipWith (+) (tail a005210_list) (map (2 *) a005210_list))-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 11 2014

Zeros: A051202. Consecutive equal terms: A256962.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
